## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}

df <- read.delim("clipboard") %>% drop_na()


library(tidyverse)
ggplot(df) +
geom_line(aes(x=Year,y=Outcome,color=Country))  +
geom_point(aes(x=Year,y=Outcome,color=Country)) +
scale_x_continuous(breaks=2012:2020) +
scale_colour_brewer(palette="Dark2") +
theme_bw()

m <- c("(Intercept)"="(Intercept)", "GNI_pc"="GNI per capita (US$)",
DAG="Poverty reduction (% GNI)",
IFF="Clean energy research (M US$)",
PROP_ED="Services, education %",
DA4BIO="Biodiversity (M US$)",
FFSUB="Fossil fuel subsidies ($)",
TECHCOOP="Tech cooperation (M US$)",
FDI="FDI")



mdl <- lm(Outcome ~ Year + factor(Country)+ GNI_pc +
IFF + DAG + PROP_ED + DA4BIO + FFSUB + TECHCOOP  + FDI, data=df)

modelsummary(list(`SDG1 progress`=mdl), stars=TRUE, fmt=  "%.1e", coef_map=m,gof_omit = "L|F|B|Adj",
statistic = NA, estimate="{estimate} ({std.error}){stars}")
summary(mdl)

mdl <- lm(Outcome ~ Year + factor(Country)+ GNI_pc +
DAG + IFF  , data=df)
modelsummary(list(`SDG1 progress`=mdl), stars=TRUE,
coef_map = m, fmt=  "%.1e", gof_omit = "L|F|B|Adj",
statistic = NA, estimate="{estimate} ({std.error}){stars}")
summary(mdl)


library(MASS)
# Fit the full model 
full.model <- lm(Outcome ~ Year + factor(Country)+ GNI_pc +
IFF + DAG + PROP_ED + DA4BIO + FFSUB + TECHCOOP  + FDI, data=df)
# Stepwise regression model
step.model <- stepAIC(full.model, direction = "both", 
                      trace = FALSE)
summary(step.model)






```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
